articles.headline: White House Intruder’s Past Raises Concern
articles.snippet: Omar Gonzalez, the intruder, was arrested in July in Virginia after the state police there found several loaded semiautomatic weapons in his car after a high-speed chase on Interstate 81.
articles.abstract: Omar Gonzalez, the intruder, was arrested in July in Virginia after the state police there found several loaded semiautomatic weapons in his car after a high-speed chase on Interstate 81.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Secret Service officers stopped Omar Jose Gonzalez last month as he carried a hatchet in front of the White House, but let him go even though he had been arrested this summer in Virginia with a mini-arsenal of semiautomatic weapons, a sniper rifle and a map clearly marking the White House’s location.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Michael S. Schmidt

articles.headline: U.S. Acts to Curb Firms’ Moves Overseas to Avoid Taxes
articles.snippet: The rules would make it more difficult for American companies to lower their tax bills by relocating overseas and would wipe out the benefits for those that do.
articles.abstract: The rules would make it more difficult for American companies to lower their tax bills by relocating overseas and would wipe out the benefits for those that do.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew announced rules on Monday that are aimed at making it more difficult for American companies to lower their tax bills by relocating overseas and that would wipe out the benefits for those that do. It is the administration’s latest move to sidestep a paralyzed Congress and tackle a politically charged element of President Obama’s agenda.

articles.headline: Fresh Graves Point to Undercount of Ebola Toll
articles.snippet: While the Sierra Leone Health Ministry has confirmed 10 Ebola deaths, a Freetown cemetery said it had added 110 graves in eight days alone.
articles.abstract: While the Sierra Leone Health Ministry has confirmed 10 Ebola deaths, a Freetown cemetery said it had added 110 graves in eight days alone.
articles.lead_paragraph: FREETOWN, Sierra Leone — The gravedigger hacked at the cemetery’s dense undergrowth, clearing space for the day’s Ebola victims. A burial team, in protective suits torn with gaping holes, arrived with fresh bodies.

articles.headline: A Tailor-Made Publisher Taking Over Jeff Bezos’ Washington Post
articles.snippet: Frederick J. Ryan Jr., the new publisher of The Washington Post, is known for his style and social connections — in many ways the polar opposite of Jeff Bezos, the owner.
articles.abstract: Frederick J. Ryan Jr., the new publisher of The Washington Post, is known for his style and social connections — in many ways the polar opposite of Jeff Bezos, the owner.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Frederick J. Ryan Jr. juggles black-tie invitations, while Jeff Bezos shuns the social limelight for reading about space travel.

articles.headline: High Hopes for Russia Are Fading on Wall St.
articles.snippet: Russia, which was supposed to be a growth market for Wall Street, is turning out to be a potential financial and political nightmare amid the Ukraine situation and America’s sanctions.
articles.abstract: Russia, which was supposed to be a growth market for Wall Street, is turning out to be a potential financial and political nightmare amid the Ukraine situation and America’s sanctions.
articles.lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs has an office in Moscow. So do Citigroup and Morgan Stanley. JPMorgan Chase and Bank of America Merrill Lynch, too.

articles.headline: Airstrikes by U.S. and Allies Hit ISIS Targets in Syria
articles.snippet: Airstrikes, conducted with several Arab allies, unleashed a torrent of cruise missiles and precision-guided bombs on the militants’ de facto capital, Raqqa, Syria.
articles.abstract: Airstrikes, conducted with several Arab allies, unleashed a torrent of cruise missiles and precision-guided bombs on the militants’ de facto capital, Raqqa, Syria.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States and allies launched airstrikes against Sunni militants in Syria early Tuesday, unleashing a torrent of cruise missiles and precision-guided bombs from the air and sea on the militants’ de facto capital of Raqqa and along the porous Iraq border.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: North Carolina, in Political Flux, Battles for Its Identity
articles.snippet: The state often seems as if it is moving in two directions at once, with the Democratic and Republican parties exhibiting gains and their members coexisting as neighbors.
articles.abstract: The state often seems as if it is moving in two directions at once, with the Democratic and Republican parties exhibiting gains and their members coexisting as neighbors.
articles.lead_paragraph: SILER CITY, N.C. — In Raleigh, conservative Republicans may be running North Carolina like they own it, but go almost anyplace in the state, even to this former textile town that looks like a movie-set re-creation of an older, more traditional South, and the political picture quickly blurs.

articles.headline: In Airstrikes, U.S. Targets Militant Cell Said to Plot an Attack Against the West
articles.snippet: American forces took advantage of the strikes against the Islamic State in Syria to try to also wipe out the leadership of an unrelated cell that the White House said was plotting against the United States or Europe.
articles.abstract: American forces took advantage of the strikes against the Islamic State in Syria to try to also wipe out the leadership of an unrelated cell that the White House said was plotting against the United States or Europe.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — American forces took advantage of the airstrikes against the Islamic State extremist group in Syria to try to simultaneously wipe out the leadership of an unrelated cell of veterans of Al Qaeda that the White House said Tuesday was plotting an “imminent” attack against the United States or Europe.

articles.headline: Startling Sight Where Blasts Are the Norm
articles.snippet: Looming over the new campaign are memories of recent American-led interventions in Libya and Iraq, which ultimately led to new waves of instability.
articles.abstract: Looming over the new campaign are memories of recent American-led interventions in Libya and Iraq, which ultimately led to new waves of instability.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — When the predawn blasts rattled their windows and jolted them from sleep, residents of Raqqa, the Syrian city that is the de facto capital of the Islamic State, thought they were in for a new round of airstrikes from the Syrian government.
